dialog.text: The sky occupies a fifth of the frame. The ground beneath it is yellow grass with a wide river running vertically to the left.
The river is takes up over half of the screen on the left side, but there is still a small patch of land to the left of it. The river begins on the left side of the screen and curves upwards.
Nothing in the river. There are very very very small mountains above the river. So on the left side of the screen it goes some sky, some mountain, some grass, then the river.
There are very light clouds on the left side.
The river and the sky don't meet. There is a thin boundary of grass and trees between them. The grass is dry and long.
The mountain is very small, and is a background object. It's about one sixteenth of the height of the frame.
The river doesn't touch the bottom edge of the screen. It curves to the left side of the frame. There are a few small trees on the right side near the top of the grass.
is the portion of grass correct? anything else i still need to at on?

I have no more peeks left. Just make sure that the river curves into the left edge of the frame, so that it doesn't touch the bottom edge. The trees aren't a focal point; they're just in the distance.
